meanings.definition: Be in charge of or deal with
meanings.sent1: I can manage the class while the teacher is away.
meanings.sent2: She will manage the project effectively.
meanings.sent3: Trying to manage a group of puppies is quite a challenge.
meanings.sent4: She managed the situation like a skilled captain navigating a storm.
meanings.sent5: He managed the situation with calm and control.

meanings.definition: Succeed in surviving or in achieving something despite difficult circumstances
meanings.sent1: The team will manage to win the game against all odds.
meanings.sent2: Despite the storm, she managed to reach the summit.
meanings.sent3: The little plant managed to grow in the crack of the sidewalk.
meanings.sent4: She managed to escape the maze of challenges in her path.
meanings.sent5: Against all odds, they managed to survive the harsh winter.

meanings.definition: Control or be in charge of a business, organization, or group
meanings.sent1: He will manage the company's finances with expertise.
meanings.sent2: She manages the team with a fair and firm hand.
meanings.sent3: The penguins managed their own version of a business selling fish.
meanings.sent4: She managed the organization like a conductor leading an orchestra.
meanings.sent5: He managed the group with efficiency and clear direction.
